instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
To start off, This board and the schematics i aquired seem to be different. Some bits on the schematic appear to be missing compared to all of the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards i have.  

I am measuring dcin and only getting 18v instead of 25v The backlight connector does not get above 8v.
Not sure where to go from here. Have tried multiple dc in boards and connectors.
We also do not get power unless both the battery and charger are plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
"I am measuring dcin and only getting 18v instead of 25v"
Where exactly and why assume 25V???

I recommend you solve the power problem before go ahead.
Exact value for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with charger and w/ and w/o battery?
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  with battery reads 8.55v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> without battery reads 8.56v
Resistance Between pin 17/18 is 3.2 and pin 27/28 is reading 20.5

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
Seems to have a problem with battery bus.
Check resistance to ground (diode mode) for SCL/SDA lines of that bus.

threads.message:
SCL is giving 11.23kohm pin4
SDA is giving 46.5 kohm pin5

This is with red on left usb for ground black on pins.

SDA us 11.23

threads.message:
"(diode mode)"
Diode mode (not ohm scale), red probe to ground, to be more specific...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message: Right .were closing now. I'm pretty sure that was diode mode but maybe I had it set wtong

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
You can't get "kohm" mark on diode mode...
Less than 1% difference is required there.
Even ohm scale, gave you bigger difference.
Don't forget to check voltage too.

threads.message:
Ok I believe I have the right setting.
i am using a fluke 15b+.
I rotated the selection to the ohm symbol and pressed the yellow button twice. I now have a diode symbol in the top right .presumably this is what you meant.  

SCL reads 0.504v
sca reads 0.502v

The values are pretty equal.
But you should also get similar difference on ohm scale...
Post voltage for both lines too.
Does the board start on charger only (no battery)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
Post voltage for pins 9 & 15 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

pin 15 is 0.072 each time the fan starts to spin up and drops to 0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message: smc bypass boots.. doesnt seem to be turning of altough fans are running extremely loud.. could this mean dead smc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
Fan spins at max in SMC bypass mode, that is normal behaviour.
You have some sensor which blocks SMC to start.
Check the sensors output from page 42.
Start with <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
smc dcin vsense is 18v
smc pbus vsense is 8.5v
smc cpu isense is 0.122v
we have no <CHIP>U5570</CHIP>
we have no <CHIP>U5560</CHIP>
we have no <CHIP>U5590</CHIP>
cpuvr adjust isense is 0.003
no <CHIP>U5670</CHIP>
any more we need?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message: Should we reflow smc

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
"smc dcin vsense is 18v
smc pbus vsense is 8.5v"
Are you sure???
SMC is fried then; it cannot recieve such overvoltage on any input.
Be sure to measure on <CAPACITOR>C5504</CAPACITOR>/14...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C5505</CAPACITOR> reads 1.426
<CAPACITOR>C5514</CAPACITOR> reads 3.119
but <TRANSISTOR>Q5510</TRANSISTOR> on pin 3 measure 18.5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
"<CAPACITOR>C5505</CAPACITOR> reads 1.426"
If is <CAPACITOR>C5504</CAPACITOR>, that's good.

<CAPACITOR>C5514</CAPACITOR> voltage is good enough.
Check the sensors from pages 41 & 43 too.
Pay atention to A/BMON sensors...

Be sure <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 have both correct value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
I could not find <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>/51
but on amon sense <RESISTOR>R5431</RESISTOR> i get 0.241
on bmon sense <RESISTOR>R5472</RESISTOR> 1.051

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
Probably hopeless repair.
But if you got some experience from it, is no  time waste at least...

Post voltages for 3V42 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
If no volt, post resistance to ground; allow 20s after power is removed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
It is good experience yes. And being new to this, thats very much what i need. Just to check to check oltages for 3v2 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> i put one probe on earth and one probe on the corrosponding component.
(ill check schematic to figure out which components that is). How do you know what voltages parts should be outputing? I originally got the 25v i spoke of a the start of this thread from the schematic.

threads.message:

No idea where did you get that high voltage...

on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> im getting 3.419 volts. measured this on <CAPACITOR>C5120</CAPACITOR> <RESISTOR>R5127</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
Resistance to ground on F7140?
Post some voltages for <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, basic pins 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 15, 17, 18, 19, 20, 27, 28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message: Just to check, resistance to ground is measured via the ohm selection and with the board being unpowered. black pin on ground red on output? or both on either side of the component.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
Red probe to ground, diode mode.
Switch to ohm mode for very low value, like measuring between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Or in case of VCORE power rail, which can drop untill 1 ohm...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
F7140 is 0.152v on pin 2
<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>
2 is 0.614v
3 is 0.512v
9 is 0.705v
12 is 0.306v
13 is 0.481v
15 is 0.724v
17 is 0.659 k ohm
18 is 0.655 k ohm
19 is 0.267v
20 is 0.269v
27 is 9.47 m ohm
28 is 5.81 m ohm


think that about covers it. On this boad its called <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, just checking thats what you meant as there is no <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> on this board. 
weve replaced this before but maybe it was replaced with a bad one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
"On this boad its called <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, just checking thats what you meant as there is no <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> on this board."
As seen in schematic, <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>...

"17 is 0.659 k ohm
18 is 0.655 k ohm"
I told you need to swith to ohm scale when measure between the pins; use diode mode to ground.
In fact, I didn't ask about resistance to ground on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pins: "Post some voltages for <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>"

So, I'm waiting you reply...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
Sorry my bad i misunderstood. ill need to do a bit more research tomorrow on my day off, my boss went ahead and replaced the isl chip anyway. Ill get you voltages afterwards if its still not working.
thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
Okay good news. replacing isl brought us back to the last step. it turns off in bypass mode but dies without bypass.
<RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> is 8.56
<RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR> is 8.56

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message: He just replaced <CHIP>U5600</CHIP> himself, now were getting 4v, so he replaced it the again and were still getting 4v.. im heading home now but ill check again on monday.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spins orange light, No backlight Board boot loop after hitting login screen
threads.message:
Why was replaced <CHIP>U5600</CHIP>?
Now must check for knocked off components, or broken traces.
Also check solders on the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
And once again, I asked for the ohm value of <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52; resistor value, not resistance to ground, nor voltage.
I asked voltages for some pins of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, but never saw them...

When you get back <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with correct value (8.5-8.6V), then check <SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_DISCRETE_ISENSE</SIGNAL> voltage.
